message_1: Consider a centipede game with 5 nodes, where each player can either "cooperate" or "defect" on their turn. Player 1 starts by choosing either "cooperate" or "defect", and then each subsequent player can either follow the previous player's choice or switch to the opposite choice. If any player defects, the game ends and all players receive a payoff of 0. If all players cooperate, player 5 receives a payoff of 10 and all other players receive a payoff of 5. What is the optimal strategy for each player to maximize their payoff in this game?
